definition.name: NXmicrostructure_odf

symbol.name: n_varphi_two
symbol.doc: Number of pixel per varphi section plot along the :math:`\varphi_2` slow direction.

symbol.name: n_capital_phi
symbol.doc: Number of pixel per varphi section plot along the :math:`\Phi` fast direction.

symbol.name: n_varphi_one
symbol.doc: Number of pixel per varphi section plot along the :math:`\varphi_1` fastest direction.

symbol.name: k
symbol.doc: Number of local maxima evaluated in the component analysis.

symbol.name: n_pos
symbol.doc: Number of sampled positions in orientation space.

definition.doc:
Base class to store an orientation distribution function (ODF).
An orientation distribution function is a probability distribution that details how much volume of material has a specific orientation. An ODF is computed from pole figure data in a computational process called `pole figure inversion <https://doi.org/10.1107/S0021889808030112>`_.

group.name: configuration
group.doc: Details about the algorithm used for computing the ODF.

field.name: crystal_symmetry_point_group
field.doc: Point group of the crystal structure of the phase for which the here documented phase-dependent ODF was computed following the notation of the International Table of Crystallography.

field.name: specimen_symmetry_point_group
field.doc: Point group assumed for additionally considered sample symmetries following the notation of the International Table of Crystallography.

group.name: characteristics
group.doc: Group to store descriptors for a rough classification of an ODF.

field.name: texture_index
field.doc:
The texture index :math:`t = \int_{\mathcal{SO(3)}} f(R)^{2}dR` with :math:`f(R)`, denoting the ODF is evaluated in orientation space :math:`\mathcal{SO(3)}`.
The higher it is the texture index the sharper it is the ODF.

group.name: kth_extrema
group.doc: Group to store descriptors and summary statistics for extrema of the ODF.

field.name: extrema
field.doc: Minima or maxima, if extrema is set to minima values for location and volume_fraction are sorted in increasing order. If extrema is set to maxima values for location and volume_fraction are sorted in decreasing order. Therefore, the global extremum is always the first entry in location and volume_fraction.

field.name: theta
field.doc: Disorientation threshold within which intensity of the ODF is integrated for the component analysis.

field.name: location
field.doc: Euler angle representation :math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` of the kth-most maxima in decreasing order of the intensity maximum.

field.name: volume_fraction
field.doc: Integrated ODF intensity within a theta angular region of the orientation space :math:`SO3` about each location (obeying symmetries) as specified for each location.

group.name: sampling
group.doc: The ODF intensity values (weights) as sampled with a software.

field.name: euler
field.doc: Bunge-Euler (i.e. ZXZ convention) locations of each position in orientation space for which a weight was sampled.

field.name: weight
field.doc: Weight at each sampled position following the order in euler.

group.name: phi_two_plot
group.doc:
Visualization of the ODF intensity as discretized orthogonal sections through orientation space parameterized using Bunge-Euler angles.
This is one example of typical default plots used in the texture community in materials engineering.
Mind that the orientation space is a distorted space when it using an Euler angle parameterization. Therefore, equivalent orientations show intensity contributions in eventually multiple locations.

field.name: intensity
field.doc: ODF intensity at probed locations relative to the intensity of the null model of a random texture.

field.name: varphi_one
field.doc: Pixel center angular position along the :math:`\varphi_1` direction.

field.name: capital_phi
field.doc: Pixel center angular position along the :math:`\Phi` direction.

field.name: varphi_two
field.doc: Pixel center angular position along the :math:`\varphi_2` direction.
